translation: On one autumn day in 2006, I quit my job at CCTV because I had a dream.
transcript: 2006年的秋天的一天，我辞去了中央电视台的工作，因为当时我有一个梦想。

translation: I wanted to find an answer.
transcript: 我希望去找到一个答案。

translation: Who paid the most and has contributed the most to the process of urbanization in China?
transcript: 就是在中国的城市化过程中，谁是付出代价最大、做出贡献最多的人。

translation: I came to Guangzhou and went to a lot of factories because I wanted to make a documentary about migrant workers.
transcript: 我来到了广州，额去了很多的工厂，因为我希望拍摄一部关于农民工的纪录片。

translation: After almost 20 days of looking for the subject of this documentary, I met the right couple: a man named Zhang Changhua and a woman named Chen Suqin.
transcript: 在差不多找了二十天的这个纪录片的拍摄对象之后，我碰到了这样一对夫妇，额男人姓张，叫张昌华，女人姓陈，叫陈素琴。

translation: I referred to them as brother Zhang and sister Chen.
transcript: 我喊他们张哥和陈姐。

translation: When I met them for the first time, Chen told me about their story.
transcript: 陈姐在我们第一次见面的时候，跟我讲了他们自己的故事。

translation: She told me that 16 years ago she left her 8-month-old daughter to work in Guangzhou, around 1994 or 1995.
transcript: 她跟我说，16年前，她离开她8个月大的女儿，来广州打工，她说那是在94年、95年的时候。

translation: On that day, she and her husband together packed all of their belongings, and all of her sisters came to see her off.
transcript: 这一天她和她的丈夫，一起打点好行装，她所有的姐妹都来送她。

translation: Sister Chen said, "I was holding my daughter Zhang Qin. She was only 8 months old then."
transcript: 陈姐说：“我抱着我的女儿张琴，那个时候她才只有8个月大”。

translation: She continued, "I cried and walked, and soon I came to the village entrance. My sisters tried to persuade me to stay until the child grew a bit older.
transcript: 她说：“我一边哭一边走，很快就要走到村口了，我的姐妹都劝我说‘留下来吧，等孩子大一点的时候再走’” 。

translation: She said, "But I knew in my heart that I had no choice. If I didn't go out to work to earn money, how would I be able to raise my daughter? When she grows up, would she walk the same way as I did and stay in the countryside all her life? I tried my best to hold back my tears, handed my daughter to my sister, and then followed my husband and walked out of the village without looking back.”
transcript: 她说：“可是我心里知道，我其实没有选择，如果我现在不出去打工挣钱，我怎么养得活我的女儿？她长大了以后，是不是跟我一样，要一辈子都呆在农村？可是我强忍着泪，把我的女儿给了我的姐姐，然后头也不回地跟着我老公，就走出了村子。”

translation: She said, "I heard my daughter crying, I was crying too. But there was no turning back.”
transcript: 她说：“我听见我的女儿在哭，我也在哭，但是我没有回头路。”

translation: This story touched me deeply.
transcript: 这个故事非常打动我。

translation: I decided to follow this couple for my documentary, "Homecoming Train".
transcript: 所以当时我就决定，要跟着这一对夫妇来拍摄我的这部纪录片，嗯叫《归途列车》。

translation: In the following three years, we followed the family and filmed more than 350 hours of material about their lives, work, and the round-trips between the city and the countryside.
transcript: 此后的三年时间，我们跟随这个家庭，拍摄了总共有350多个小时的素材，记录了他们生活、工作，在城市和农村之间往返的点点滴滴。

translation: This story is actually not just about the couple.
transcript: 这个故事其实不仅仅是关于这对夫妇。

translation: I think what is more important is their 8-month-old daughter, Zhang Qin.
transcript: 我觉得更重要的是，他们那个曾经8个月大的女儿：张琴。

translation: I decided to follow both the daughter and the couple and to pick up clues in the countryside and the city at the same time.
transcript: 我决定，跟随这个女儿和夫妇俩，在农村和城市两边同时展开拍摄的线索。

translation: Time flew, and after a year I returned to the countryside with the parents.
transcript: 时间过得很快，一年过去了，我我随着父母回到农村。

translation: The only thing they told their child was to study hard, go to college in the city and work there.
transcript: 我能听到他们跟孩子讲的唯一的事情就是，你们要好好学习，长大了以后一定要考上大学，到城里去念书，去城里工作。

translation: They told her not to walk their old path, sitting in front of sewing machines in a factory for a dozen years.
transcript: 不要再像爸爸妈妈这样，在一个工厂里，面对一台缝纫机，一做就是十几年。

translation: But the 16-year-old child couldn't bring herself to listen to her parents' words.
transcript: 而孩子在16岁，她很难听进父母的这一番话。

translation: As a result, in the second year of filming, Zhang Qin dropped out of school with her classmate and went to Xintang, a small city next to Guangzhou. She went to a jeans factory there and became a young worker.
transcript: 所以，在我们拍摄的第二年，张琴呢，跟随她的一个同学一起，辍学跑到了广州旁边的一个小城市叫新塘，她在新塘找到了一家牛仔裤工厂，在那儿当起了一个年轻的工人。

translation: What Zhang Qin had done made her parents lose sleep.
transcript: 张琴的这个举动，其实让她的父母彻夜难眠。

translation: All their dedication seemed to turn to dust and ashes in that moment.
transcript: 因为他们一辈子的付出，仿佛在一瞬间都化成了灰烬。

translation: When the Chinese New Year of 2008 was about to come, brother Zhang and sister Chen couldn’t help it anymore and went to Zhang Qin’s factory to take her home.
transcript: 所以在2008年的春节就要来临的时候，张哥和陈姐他们俩再也忍不住了，他们跑到张琴的工厂，像抓小鸡一样地把她给带回来了。

translation: They were quite bothered but managed to get return train tickets despite the holiday.
transcript: 然后一家人费尽周折，买好了春节回老家的火车票。

translation: The whole family came to Guangzhou Station and waited to return to their hometown of Guang’an.
transcript: 这时候一家人来到了广州火车站，准备坐火车回老家广安。

translation: You probably still remember the snowstorm that the whole country suffered during the Chinese New Year of 2008.
transcript: 大家一定还记得在2008年的春节，整个中国遭遇了一场50年不遇的大雪灾。

translation: All the trains were canceled.
transcript: 所有的火车都停开了。

translation: Six million people were held up at Guangzhou Station for seven days.
transcript: 在广州火车站当时有600万人，困在这个火车站的广场上，长达7天之久。

translation: The Zhang family and our crew were there too.
transcript: 而张琴他们一家人也就困在那儿，还有我们的摄制组。

translation: So in our film, “Homecoming Train”, there is a part about this.
transcript: 所以在《归途列车》这部影片里，有一段这个视频。

translation: Let’s take a look.
transcript: 我们可以看一下。

translation: Although I have seen it thousands of times, it makes me sad every single time.
transcript: 这段视频其实我每次看了以后都会特别难受，虽然我已经看了无数次了。

translation: At the beginning of the video, there is a little girl in pink.
transcript: 在视频的开始有一个小女孩儿，穿着粉红色的衣服。

translation: As you can see, she wipes tears from her eyes and rushes out of the crowd with a bag several times larger than her.
transcript: 大家都看到了，她从人群里，抹着眼泪，背着一个比她要大几倍的包，冲出来。

translation: She was out of breath and couldn’t stand it any longer.
transcript: 她实在是受不了了，她气喘吁吁。

translation: It was likely that she had been there for 3 days and nights.
transcript: 她可能已经在那个火车站里站了3天3夜了。

translation: She put her bag on the pedestrian steps.
transcript: 她把包放在人行的台阶上。

translation: A policeman helped her to put the big sack back on her shoulder.
transcript: 然后有一个武警的小战士，帮她把她的大一个麻袋，放回到她的肩上。

translation: She wiped her tears again and then disappeared into the crowd.
transcript: 她抹了眼泪，一秒钟都没有停，重新扎回到人流里，然后，就消失了。

translation: I was there right next to the camera.
transcript: 因为当时我在摄影机旁边。

translation: I saw her and I thought I would never see her again.
transcript: 我是看到这个女孩儿在那儿，然后我想我再也不会见到她了。

translation: It felt like a knife stabbing my heart.
transcript: 但是那一瞬间，就好像一一把刀插到我的心里。

translation: I understand why she couldn’t stay put for a second.
transcript: 我很理解这个女孩儿为什么一秒钟都不能停。

translation: It was because if she didn't catch her train, she wouldn’t be able to see her relatives for a total of two years.
transcript: 因为如果她赶不上这一列火车，她两年都没有办法见到她的亲人。

translation: I was thinking, was this the price that must be paid for China’s urbanization?
transcript: 我在这个拍摄的过程中我就想，这是不是就是中国城市化的一个必须付出的代价？

translation: Who was paying for it then?
transcript: 那是谁在付出这个代价？

translation: Should we remember these people, who paid such a price?
transcript: 我们应不应该记住这些人，曾经付出了这样的代价？

translation: They would also like to enjoy the fruits of the country’s economic development, and they hoped to be a part of it.
transcript: 他们也希望能够享受，这个国家经济发展所带来的一切的成果，他们也希望成为这当中的一份子。

translation: In fact, during the three years of filming, we spent at least six months a year in the factory to get all kinds of scenes like this.
transcript: 事实上在三年的拍摄当中，每年至少有6个月的时间会在这个工厂去，嗯，拍摄各种各样的这个场景。

translation: Shots like this often appear: children sit along a road with big bundles of jeans to be exported to all over the world; young people still have their dreams.
transcript: 所以你经常会看到像这样子的镜头：孩子坐在路边，大捆大捆的牛仔裤全都是出口到世界各地的；年轻人依然有梦想。

translation: Although they had to work a dozen hours a day, some of the motivated ones would read books afterwards, hoping to jump out of the factory one day.
transcript: 虽然他们每天要工作十几个小时，所以有一些上进的孩子们会继续看书，希望能够学习更多的知识，然后有朝一日可以跳出这个工厂的圈子。

translation: You can see this everywhere.
transcript: 这样的场景无处不在。

translation: Is this the price for urbanization?
transcript: 所以这是不是也是城市化的一种代价呢？

translation: Migration from rural to urban areas does not happen only in China, nor does it only occur today.
transcript: 这种从农村向城市的迁徙，其实并不只发生在中国，也并不只发生在今天。

translation: 100 years ago, on the European continent, farmers began to leave the countryside and were transformed from peasants into the urban working class.
transcript: 在100年以前，欧洲大陆，就不断地有农民开始离开农村，额，从农民转化成这个额城市的工人阶级。

translation: They tended to settle down in the center of cities and then slowly build up their own networks of acquaintances.
transcript: 嗯他们往往都会先落脚在一个城市的中心，然后慢慢建立自己的这个熟人网络。

translation: At the same time, those who originally lived in the cities were very hostile to them.
transcript: 与此同时，那些原本生活在城市的人，对这群新来的人，是非常排斥的。

translation: It is said that a few days ago, some Beijing parents went to protest at the doors of the Ministry of Education against the decision that the children of outsiders could also take part in the college entrance exam in Beijing.
transcript: 前几天北京刚刚发生了一件事情是，据说有一些这个北京的家长，跑到教育部的门口去抗议，抗议什么呢，抗议啊外地人的孩子也可以在北京参加高考了。

translation: They think that outsider students rob from the shared resources for education, which they feel is not right.
transcript: 他们认为这个外来的呃这些学生，抢或者分享了教育的资源，他们觉得这样是不对的。

translation: So this is very ironic, I think.
transcript: 所以这是一个非常讽刺的事件，我觉得。

translation: This is because you need to think about who built these high-rise buildings, who is working on the construction sites, who is serving us in the restaurants, who is paving the roads for us?
transcript: 因为你要想一想是谁建立了这些高楼大厦？是谁在工地上工作？是谁在餐馆里给我们端盘子、洗盘子？是谁在为我们铺路？

translation: Everything is built by these migrant workers.
transcript: 一切的一切都是这些外来的工人在建设。

translation: Our economy cannot make it without them, no matter whether it is the export-oriented economy or infrastructure investments.
transcript: 我们的经济缺不了他们，无论是外向型的经济，还是我们的基础建设投资，都缺不了他们。

translation: In the story we filmed, Zhang Qin is a representative example of the migrant workers born in the 1980s and 1990s.
transcript: 在我们拍摄的这个纪录片的故事当中，张琴这个女孩儿，她作为80后90后的农民工的一个代表，她来到城市。

translation: In fact, she is an example of failure, because she didn’t finish her education, and so she could only become a worker.
transcript: 其实她是一个非常失败的例子，因为她没有教育，她只能打工。

translation: Two years after we filmed the documentary, she wandered through several cities across China.
transcript: 她在我们拍摄完这个纪录片之后的两年，漂泊在整个中国的好几个城市。

translation: She went to Hubei, went to Beijing for school, and then went to work in Guangdong.
transcript: 她去过湖北，去过北京上学，然后去广东打工。

translation: Everything is only temporary for her, as there are no fixed jobs to take her in, so she will always be rootless.
transcript: 一切都是暂时的，对她来说，没有一个固定的工作把她接纳进来，所以她永远是一个无根的，漂泊的状态。

translation: Nowadays, there is a large part of history that happens to be experienced and created by rootless people like her.
transcript: 而今天的世界，有很大一部分历史，正好是她这样无根的人，所在经历和创造的。

translation: Last year I gave sister Chen, the mother, a call.
transcript: 我记得去年我给陈姐，也就是她的妈这个母亲打过一个电话。

translation: She is taking care of her son in her hometown, because she feels that, since she has been away from home for so many years, her son hates her a lot.
transcript: 她现在回老家去照顾儿子了，因为她觉得，她这么多年都没有在家里嗯照顾孩子，导致她的孩子非常的恨她。

translation: Her daughter said, “I don’t have a father or a mother. They have never loved me.”
transcript: 她她的女儿说：“我没有这个父亲，也没有这个母亲，因为他们从来没有爱过我。”

translation: Chen said, “I really want to apologize to my daughter, but I cannot find her.”
transcript: 所以陈姐回去以后她说：“我很想跟我的女儿说一声‘对不起’，可是我找不到她。”

translation: Zhang Qin is not willing to speak a word to them anymore, and I have become the solitary middleman between them, sometimes even exchanging messages for them.
transcript: 因为张琴不愿意再和他们说一句话，我成了他们当中唯一的一个中间人，有时候我会把他们的消息相互交换一下。

translation: A family of two generations just broke down like this.
transcript: 两代人、一个家庭就这么，就这么破碎掉了。

translation: Is that the price of urbanization?
transcript: 这是不是城市化的代价呢？

translation: What I want to say is, in order to prevent this tragedy from happening again to China’s 240 million migrant workers, I hope we can stop to think about what can be done.
transcript: 所以我想说，为了不让这样子的悲剧再发生，为了不让这样子的悲剧发生在中国的两点四亿的农民工身上，我希望我们可以停下来想一想，我们可以做什么？

translation: Can we give the children of migrant workers equal educational rights?
transcript: 我们能不能让外来工的孩子受到平等的教育权？

translation: Can we give factory workers equal social benefits?
transcript: 我们能不能让在工厂里工作的工人能够有平等的社会福利？

translation: Can they have equal wages?
transcript: 他们可不可以有平等的工资待遇？

translation: For the people who work hard on construction sites day and night, will there be a day in which they can sit with us at "TnDao" to learn and to integrate into this society?
transcript: 在工地上日日夜夜，这个辛劳、洒汗的人，他们是不是终将有一日，可以和我们坐在一起来“听道”，来学习，来融入这个社会？

translation: These are the questions that we need to ask everyone.
transcript: 这是我们需要问每个人的问题。

translation: Thank you.
transcript: 谢谢！
